instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437 Green / Orange Light but wont turn on.
threads.message:
Following on from previous repair. This board had a new U7100, Q7130, DC In Board and DC Flex Cable to bring back green/orange light. It still wont turn on and I have the following:

PPBUS_G3H = 8.5v
PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS = 8.5v
PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS = 8.5v
PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL = 14.9v
PPDCIN_G3H = 14.9v

PP3V42_G3H = 3.42v
PPVRTC_G3H = 3.32v

PP5V_S5 = 5v
PP3V3_S5 = 3.32v
PP3V3_S4 = 3.32v

PP5V_S4RS3 = Dead / Pulsing
PP5V_S4RS3_EN = Dead / Pulsing
PP5V_S0 = Dead / Pulsing
PPVCC_S0_CPU = Dead / Pulsing
(The pulsing is so quick that the multi meter has trouble recording the values.)

No fan spin at all.

Nothing looks corroded here but I have checked all resistors, traces and continuity around Y1905, U6100 and U1900 and everything checks out.

Any help much appreciated.

threads.title: 820-3437 Green / Orange Light but wont turn on.
threads.message: The usual, U6100 data lines termination resistors and traces, pin 8 U1950.

threads.title: 820-3437 Green / Orange Light but wont turn on.
threads.message:
U1950, Pin 8 = 3.4v

U6100 has continuity to everything it should.
Pin 1 = 3.27v
Pin 2 = 3.27v
Pin 3 = 3.32v
Pin 4 = GND
Pin 5 = 0v
Pin 6 = 0v
Pin 7 = 3.0v
Pin 8 = 3.32v

R6128 = 26.7ohm has continuity to R6113=15ohm and R6123=25ohm
R6127 = 43ohm has continuity to R6122=43ohm and R6112=15ohm
R6126 = 43ohm has continuity to R6111=15ohm and R6121=43ohm
R6125 = 45ohm has continuity to R6110=15ohm and R6120=43ohm

R6114 = 25ohm has continuity to R6123 and SPI_MLB_MISO
R6115 = 15ohm has continuity to R6122 SPI_MLB_MOSI
R6116 = 15ohm has continuity to R6121 and SPI_MLB_CLK
R6117 = 15.8ohm has continuity to R6120 and SPI_MLB_CS_L

threads.title: 820-3437 Green / Orange Light but wont turn on.
820-3437 Green / Orange Light but wont turn on.
threads.message: Yes multi meter only catching it jump to 0.2-0.3v max.

threads.title: 820-3437 Green / Orange Light but wont turn on.
threads.message: I still suspect a problem in U6100 area. Can you take a good picture of the area?

threads.title: 820-3437 Green / Orange Light but wont turn on.
threads.message:
No Title

Sure, how are these?

threads.title: 820-3437 Green / Orange Light but wont turn on.
threads.message:
I've been taking a look at some old posts and found this. Replace BIOS time?

[url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/12335-solved-820-3437-no-pm_slp_s4_l[/url]

threads.title: 820-3437 Green / Orange Light but wont turn on.
threads.message: It is possible but highly unlikely. If you have a donor swap the chip, ALWAYS keep a backup and put back original if there is no change.

threads.title: 820-3437 Green / Orange Light but wont turn on.
threads.message: If it's highly unlikely then I'd definitely prefer to exhaust all other options first. Any thing wrong in those pictures? Anything else to test or try before the BIOS? Cheers

threads.title: 820-3437 Green / Orange Light but wont turn on.
threads.message: I see nothing wrong. Power cycling can be caused by anything, it is the worst thing to fix. Only thing I can say is inspect for corrosion or damaged parts.

threads.title: 820-3437 Green / Orange Light but wont turn on.
threads.message: Cheers Duke, I will have to take another thorough look over everything. Last resort will be BIOS chip and if no joy, it's one for the bin or eBay...

threads.title: 820-3437 Green / Orange Light but wont turn on.
threads.message: Don't Ebay it, someone will come here again with the same garbage......
